intro: Platycodon grandiflorus var. pentapetalus, commonly known as the five-petaled bellflower, is a variant of the Chinese bellflower. It is a herbaceous perennial native to East Asia, characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its flowers have five petals, which is a distinguishing feature from the typical four-petaled form of the species. This variety is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and is often used in garden landscapes.
